featured.text: I love them.” 17 this, Aesop answered, “I’m happy to tell you, my dear friend, that you’ll find the people of Athens much the same.”
Aesop replied, “Tell me where you come from and what sort of people live there, and I’ll tell you what sort of people you’ll find in Athens.”
He too stopped and asked Aesop the same question.
“Well, I’m afraid you’ll find the people of Athens much the same,” replied Aesop.

definition.zh_def: 伊索，古希臘寓言作家，以其寓言故事聞名，通常包含道德教訓。
definition.en_def: Aesop, an ancient Greek storyteller known for his fables, which often convey moral lessons.
definition.example: The story of the tortoise and the hare is one of Aesop's most famous fables.
